fallbacks_used: CNBC for real yields (FRED 1 day old)

macro_environment.summary: Weak USD supporting commodities and risk assets. Credit spreads narrowing, favorable for equities especially small caps. Strong commodity complex (copper, oil) signaling growth resilience.
key_drivers: Weak USD supporting commodities and risk assets
Credit spreads narrowing, favorable for equities especially small caps
Strong commodity complex (copper, oil) signaling growth resilience

fed_stance.description: Market pricing 95.8% probability of no change at next meeting

growth_gdpnow.description: Stable, 3.7% is solid growth above trend

gold_etf_flows.description: Record inflows, pushing AUM to all-time highs

geopolitical_risk.description: GPR index at moderate levels, no major spike

instruments.name: Gold
instruments.rationale: Weak USD (+1), gold ETF inflows at record levels (+1), and oil supply tightening (+1) support gold. Real yields flat (0) removes headwind. Fed neutral stance provides stable backdrop.
risks: Real yields could rise if inflation data surprises
Fed hawkish pivot would be negative

instruments.name: Silver
instruments.rationale: Copper strength (+1) signals industrial demand, weak USD (+1) supportive, gold ETF inflows (+1) lift precious metals complex. Silver benefits from both industrial and monetary demand.
risks: Industrial demand could weaken if growth slows
Higher real yields would pressure precious metals

instruments.name: WTI Crude Oil
instruments.rationale: Oil supply tightening (4% below 5-yr avg, +2 weighted), inventory draw (+1), weak USD (+1) all supportive. Growth stable at 3.7% provides demand backdrop. Geopolitical risk stable but could escalate.
risks: Demand destruction if growth weakens
OPEC+ could increase production

instruments.name: S&P 500
instruments.rationale: Credit spreads narrowing (+1) and weak USD (+1) are positives, but VIX rising (-1) signals caution. Real yields flat (0) and Fed neutral (0) provide stable backdrop. Mixed signals suggest modest upside.
risks: VIX rising could signal risk-off ahead
Real yields spike would pressure valuations

instruments.name: NASDAQ 100
instruments.rationale: SOX very strong (+1, up 60% YoY) signals tech strength, weak USD (+1) supportive. However, MOVE rising (-1) indicates rate volatility concern for duration-sensitive tech. Net slight bullish.
risks: MOVE rising could trigger tech selloff
Real yields spike would hurt growth stocks

instruments.name: Dow Jones
instruments.rationale: Curve steepening (+1), credit spreads narrowing (+1), weak USD (+1) all favor value/cyclical stocks in Dow. Reflation-friendly environment. Growth stable (0) provides backdrop.
risks: Curve flattening would hurt financials
Credit spreads widening would signal risk-off

instruments.name: Russell 2000
instruments.rationale: Credit spreads narrowing (+2 weighted) is critical for small caps. Curve steepening (+1) and weak USD (+1) also supportive. Small caps benefit most from improving credit conditions.
risks: Credit spreads widening would hit small caps hardest
Growth slowdown would hurt domestic-focused names

instruments.name: Euro FX
instruments.rationale: Weak USD (+1) is main driver supporting EUR. No specific ECB catalysts or rate differential changes. Limited FX-specific drivers beyond broad USD weakness.
risks: ECB dovish pivot would weaken EUR
USD reversal would remove support

instruments.name: Australian Dollar
instruments.rationale: Copper strength (+1) supportive for commodity currency, weak USD (+1) provides tailwind. Limited China catalyst (0) caps upside. AUD benefits from risk-on and commodity strength.
risks: China growth slowdown would hurt AUD
RBA dovish pivot would weaken currency

instruments.name: Japanese Yen
instruments.rationale: Weak USD (+1) is main driver. No BoJ-specific catalyst or rate differential change. Bullish 6J means bullish JPY (bearish USD/JPY). Limited JPY-specific drivers.
risks: BoJ dovish pivot would weaken JPY
Risk-off could trigger JPY strength beyond model

commodities.summary: All 3 commodities bullish. Weak USD, strong industrial demand (copper), tight oil supply, and record gold ETF inflows driving strength.

indices.summary: Mixed signals. Small caps (RTY) and value (YM) strongest on credit/curve. Tech (NQ) and broad market (ES) slight bullish but cautious on MOVE/VIX.

fx.summary: All FX slight bullish driven by weak USD. AUD strongest on copper. EUR and JPY limited by lack of central bank catalysts.

disclaimer: This report is for informational purposes only and does not constitute investment advice. Past performance is not indicative of future results. All trading involves risk.
